messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1428 re: trashy novels
messages.msgSnippet: Now we can get into what would define a trashy novel! A subject that could get hot with some of my in-laws!! What they call literature I don t call anything at
messages.messageBody:
Now we can get into what would define a trashy novel!
A subject that could get hot with some of my in-laws!!
What they call literature I don't call anything at
all. What I enjoy quite often has subject matter they
feel should not be refered to at all.
Sharon

>
> << Is a trashy novel more worthwhile than A&E
> Biography or Discovery?
> >>
>
> Sometimes, late at night, when I'm all alone,
> YES!!!!!!!!
>
> Sandra
>
> "Everything counts."
> http://expage.com/SandraDoddArticles
> http://expage.com/SandraDodd
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1428
messages.msgSnippet: ... It was always my thought that while both have their place, TV is pretty much a passive activity while reading takes effort, effort to read and effort to
messages.messageBody:
>><< why IS reading more important than tv? >>

It was always my thought that while both have their place, TV is pretty much
a passive activity while reading takes effort, effort to read and effort to
use your imagination.>>

Is a trashy novel more worthwhile than A&E Biography or Discovery?
